text: What are two types of computer user interface? (Choose two.)
explanation: CLI (Command-Line Interface) allows users to enter text commands, while GUI (Graphical User Interface) allows interaction through icons and menus. PnP is a hardware assignment process, and the others are APIs.

text: What are two default account types provided by Windows 10? (Choose two.)
explanation: Windows 10 provides Administrator and Standard User accounts. Guest is a built-in account, DefaultAccount is system-managed, and Users is a group.

text: Which term best describes the process of breaking a program into smaller parts that can be loaded as needed by the operating system?
explanation: A thread is a small piece of a program in execution. Multiprocessing involves multiple CPUs, multiuser supports multiple users, and multitasking runs multiple apps simultaneously.

text: A computer fails to boot after a user installs a new sound card driver. Which quick fix can return it to a working state?

options.text: Boot to Last Known Good Configuration.

explanation: Last Known Good Configuration uses the registry copy saved at the last successful login. It is useful for fixing issues caused by faulty drivers.

text: What feature of an operating system allows it to support two or more CPUs?
explanation: Multiprocessing allows the OS to use multiple CPUs. Multitasking runs multiple apps, multithreading runs parts of the same program, and multiuser supports multiple users.

text: What term is used to describe a logical drive that can be formatted to store data?
explanation: Partitions are logical portions of the disk that can be formatted. They consist of physical/logical structures like tracks, sectors, and clusters.

text: Which key allows a user to start Windows in safe mode during the boot process?
explanation: Pressing the F8 key during bootup provides options such as Safe Mode.

text: Which file system is used to access files over a network?
explanation: NFS (Network File System) is designed for network file access. NTFS, FAT, and CDFS are typically for local storage.

text: Which component of a CPU architecture allows the CPU immediate access to data?
explanation: Registers are memory locations within the CPU architecture providing storage for logical functions.

text: When would the PXE option be used when repairing a PC?

options.text: The display cannot be seen clearly.
There is no response from the mouse or keyboard.
The computer needs a replacement operating system.
A newly installed application caused erratic performance.

explanation: The Preboot eXecution Environment (PXE) is used to install an OS from a remote network location.

text: Which statement accurately describes the GUID partition table (GPT)?

options.text: It is 512 bytes long and contains the boot loader.
It cannot be used in a multiboot environment.
It is commonly used in computers with UEFI firmware.
It is not supported by Windows 10 Home edition.

explanation: GPT expands on MBR limits and is the standard for UEFI firmware systems.

text: Which statement describes dynamic disks in Windows 10 Pro?

options.text: They have the ability to create volumes that span across more than one disk.
Free space can only be added from the same disk to extend the volume.
A partition can be shrunk without deleting it first.
More space can be added only if it is contiguous unallocated space.

explanation: Dynamic disks can create spanned volumes across multiple disks. Partitions can be extended into noncontiguous space.

text: A technician wants to deploy a Windows 10 upgrade and ensure user state migrates successfully. Which tool should they use?
explanation: USMT (User State Migration Tool) simplifies migration during large OS deployments.

text: Which command line utility allows users to transfer files and settings during a Windows 10 upgrade?
explanation: USMT is a command-line tool developed by Microsoft for this purpose. Windows Easy Transfer is not available in Windows 10.

text: Which operation in Windows 10 is limited to users with Administrator privileges only?
explanation: Administrator accounts have full control, including software installation, while Standard users are limited in actions that affect other users.

text: Select the Windows 10 version that best meets the described use.

columnB.text: Used for personal computing and gaming with built-in features like family safety and parental control.
Used in an academic environment with volume licensing options.
Used in small business environments with built-in security, productivity, and management features.
Used in large to mid-size business environments requiring advanced security and management features.

text: Match the file system with the respective description.

columnB.text: Supports partition sizes up to 16 exabytes and incorporates file system security features and extended attributes.
Usually used on flash drives as it can support files larger than 4GB.
Supports partition sizes up to 2TB or 2,048GB.
Created specifically for optical disk media.
A network-based file system that allows file access over the network.

text: Match the steps that will lead to the loading of bootmgr.exe in a 32 bit Windows 10 environment.
Which statement describes a primary partition?

options.text: It is a physical section of a hard disk that can contain an OS and cannot be subdivided.
It is a section of an extended partition on an MBR.
It is a type of disk spanning multiple disks.
It is used to subdivide data into 23 logical sections.

explanation: A primary partition is a physical section that can host an OS and cannot be subdivided.

text: Which statement describes formatting?

options.text: It is a process to create a file system in a partition or volume for file storage.
It subdivides data into as many as 23 logical sections.
It separates information for administrative purposes.
It is used to boot an operating system by default.

explanation: Formatting creates a file system on a partition for storage purposes.

text: Which statement describes the active partition?

options.text: It is used to boot an operating system by default.
It separates information for administrative purposes.
It allows spanning volumes across multiple disks.
It subdivides data into 23 logical sections.

explanation: The active partition is the one used by the BIOS to boot the operating system.

text: Which statement describes a recovery partition?

options.text: It contains an image used to restore the computer to its original configuration.
It creates a file system for file storage.
It allows spanning across multiple disks.
It separates information for administrative purposes.

explanation: Recovery partitions are usually inaccessible to the user and contain factory restoration images.

text: Which statement describes an extended partition?

options.text: It can be subdivided into as many as 23 logical sections.
It creates a file system for storage.
It allows spanning across more than one disk.

explanation: On MBR disks, an extended partition allows the creation of multiple logical drives.

text: Which statement describes the master boot record (MBR)?

options.text: It takes the first 512 bytes on the disk and contains the boot loader.
It creates a file system for storage.
It spans across more than one disk.

explanation: The MBR is the first 512 bytes of the drive containing the boot loader executable.

text: Which statement describes a logical drive?

options.text: It is a section of an extended partition on an MBR used for administrative separation.
It creates a file system for storage.

explanation: Logical drives are subdivisions of an extended partition used for data organization.

text: A technician wants to transfer selected files and profiles to a new Windows 10 PC. What is the best choice?
explanation: PCmover Express is recommended for moving selected files and applications between PCs.

text: A manager needs help with the setup process for a direct Windows 10 installation. What utility is best?
explanation: Upgrade Assistant helps guide the user through the setup and installation process.

text: A technician needs to capture accounts and OS settings for migration. What utility is best?
explanation: USMT is specifically designed to capture accounts, files, and settings for migration.

text: A technician wants to check system compatibility before upgrading to Windows 10. What utility is best?
explanation: Upgrade Assistant checks hardware and software compatibility before the upgrade.

text: True or False? Smartphones require an operating system before they can be operated.
explanation: All smartphones require an OS (like Android or iOS) to manage hardware and run apps.

text: True or False? Modern operating systems support only one user, task, or CPU.
explanation: Modern OSs are multiuser, multitasking, and multiprocessing.

text: True or False? The OS needs a device driver to access and use installed hardware.
explanation: Device drivers act as translators between the hardware and the OS.

text: True or False? There is no difference between local and network file access in a network file system.
explanation: A network file system aims to make remote files appear and act as if they are stored locally.

text: True or False? Windows 10 64-bit version can be installed on as little as 1GB of hard drive space.
explanation: Windows 10 requires significantly more space (typically 20GB+ for 64-bit) for installation.

text: True or False? DirectX is a collection of APIs related to multimedia tasks for Microsoft Windows.
explanation: DirectX provides APIs for graphics, audio, and gaming performance.

text: True or False? The registry database only contains information about device drivers.
explanation: The registry contains settings for hardware, software, users, and OS preferences.

text: True or False? Multitasking describes an OS capable of running multiple applications at once.
explanation: Multitasking manages resource allocation to allow multiple programs to appear to run simultaneously.

text: True or False? Multithreading describes an operating system that can support two or more CPUs.
explanation: Multiprocessing supports multiple CPUs; multithreading breaks a single program into smaller executable parts.

text: True or False? A 32-bit operating system can address up to a maximum of 4 GB of RAM.
explanation: The 4GB limit is a direct result of the 32-bit architecture's addressing capabilities.
